title: Business Skills (provisional) visas (subclasses 160-165)
summary: This page provides detailed information about the closed Business Skills (Provisional) visas (subclasses 160–165). It explains who can still apply, how family members can be added, associated costs, application instructions, and conditions after applying. Health, character, document, and post‑lodgement requirements are also outlined.

visa_program.name: Business Skills (Provisional) visas
who_can_still_apply: Family members of people who already hold one of the visas
Family members of applicants who lodged an undecided application

visa_grant_location_rules.general_rule: Applicant must be outside Australia when the visa is granted
visa_grant_location_rules.exception: Applicants who held a student visa at the time of application may be in or outside Australia when granted

adding_family_members.applicable_to: Dependent children can be added until the visa application is decided
dependent_children_definition: Children 18 or older who cannot work due to incapacity
Children not married, not engaged, and without a de facto partner

required_form.description: Application for a Business Skills (provisional) visa

adding_family_members.required_documents: Documents listed in the document checklist

eligible_family_members: Dependent children or partner’s dependent children
requirements: IELTS test may be required to demonstrate English ability

health_requirements.notes: Most applicants will not need additional health examinations
health_requirements.instruction: Do not arrange a health examination until requested

character_requirements.police_certificate_requirement: Police certificate required for each country lived in for 12 months or more during the past 10 years after turning 16

debts_to_government.requirement: Applicant must have no outstanding debts or must arrange repayment before visa grant

where_to_lodge_application.if_in_prc_hong_kong_macau_taiwan: Send documents to the Australian Consulate-General Hong Kong
where_to_lodge_application.if_elsewhere: Send documents by registered post to Adelaide office, Client Services, Adelaide Business Skills Processing Centre

after_applying.acknowledgement: Applicant will receive confirmation of receipt

factors_that_cause_delays: Need for character or health checks
waiting_for_decision.travel_warning: Applicants outside Australia should not arrange travel until written grant notification

providing_more_information.interview_notes: Applicants may be interviewed and must bring identification and requested documents

examples: Changes to phone number, email, address or passport
obligation_to_report_changes.consequence_of_not_updating_passport: May cause delays at airport or boarding denial

if_refused: Sponsor may request review if applicable

notes: Provide certified copies of original documents
Provide accredited English translations for non-English documents

forms.description: Personal particulars for assessment including character assessment
forms.applicable_to: Any family unit member 18 or older included in the application
